revised_title: Barnes Neville Wallis: A Pioneering Engineer and Airship Designer
tldr: This article is a biography of Barnes Neville Wallis, an extraordinary engineer and airship designer. It covers his early life, education, and career, focusing on his contributions to airship design and engineering during World War I. Wallis worked on various airship projects, including the R.9, R.23, R.26, and R.80, and played a significant role in the development of airships as a mode of transportation and military strategy.
